programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: Wonders of Mexico
programme.sub-title: Mexico is a vast country; over 2,000 miles long, its dominated by a great chain of mountains known as the Sierra Madre. Journey down this rocky spine and youll discover an amazing diversity of life.
programme.desc: This documentary series reveals Mexicos astonishing wildlife, landscape and culture as we pay a visit to the ancient temples of the Maya, the Sierra Madre, and the Sonoran and Chihuahuan deserts.

programme.title: Wild Talk
programme.sub-title: We learn about the variety of sounds animals use when they need to communicate; with the help of scientists, we eavesdrop into the secret conversations going on all around us in the animal kingdom.
programme.desc: Recent years have seen an explosion of research into zoosemiotics (the science of animal communications); experts are listening to animals on their own terms to decode their secret languages.

programme.title: Natures Fast Attacks
programme.sub-title: This first episode features footage showing the lightning-fast moves that predators deploy to capture their prey and the rapid escape tactics that will see who wins these high-velocity battles.
programme.desc: In this two-part documentary series, we see footage that captures the lightning-fast moves used to ambush prey and make equally rapid escapes in the terrifying moments between life and death.

programme.title: Natures Fast Attacks
programme.sub-title: In the battle between predator and prey, we explore how deception and speed can often be the difference between life and death; even some of the fastest hunters use stealth to trick their prey.
programme.desc: In this two-part documentary series, we see footage that captures the lightning-fast moves used to ambush prey and make equally rapid escapes in the terrifying moments between life and death.

programme.title: Wild Fighters
programme.sub-title: We often witness combats of all kinds in the animal kingdom - from hand-to-hand fighting to fierce fashion shows and extravagant tournaments - but what is behind all these wild competitions?
programme.desc: Animals fight to ensure their survival, but what are the reasons that make them risk their lives every day, and what are the consequences of winning or losing these battles?

programme.title: Wonders of Mexico
programme.sub-title: The temples of the Maya tower over the forests of the Yucatan; the watery underworld is still being explored and holds the key to how animals and people survive the dry season.
programme.desc: This documentary series reveals Mexicos astonishing wildlife, landscape and culture as we pay a visit to the ancient temples of the Maya, the Sierra Madre, and the Sonoran and Chihuahuan deserts.

programme.title: A Year on Planet Earth
programme.sub-title: Winter has begun as the Northern Hemisphere freezes; life is at its hardest with less solar energy, and the Arctic sun has set and wont return until the spring.
programme.desc: We journey around the Sun in this series and witness the incredible strategies that animals use to cope with every season in their constantly changing worlds.

programme.title: A Year on Planet Earth
programme.sub-title: Transformation is enormous as the Northern Hemisphere starts to face the suns rays in March; spring is a season of opportunity as the great melt begins and new life erupts.
programme.desc: We journey around the Sun in this series and witness the incredible strategies that animals use to cope with every season in their constantly changing worlds.

programme.title: The Worlds Most Beautiful Landscapes
programme.sub-title: We explore the extraordinary landscape of Snowdonia, from the wildlife of the Llyn Peninsula to slate mines, rainforest, and the magnificent peaks of Tryfan and Mount Snowdon itself.
programme.desc: Travel through the worlds most beautiful landscapes; from wide views to the tiniest close-up, witness spectacular footage and discover the glories of rivers, jungles, and mountains from every angle.

programme.title: Natures Ultimate Survivors
programme.sub-title: From surprisingly nurturing reptiles to birds and turtles that employ clever strategies to deceive predators and protect their young, parenthood takes many forms in the wild.
programme.desc: We explore a diverse range of topics that showcase the incredible survival skills animals have developed over time and feature our top 20 animal species for each of these categories.

programme.title: Natures Mass Attacks
programme.sub-title: In the battle to eat or be eaten, its not always the mighty that win; featuring animals from the gigantic to the miniature, this is a fascinating look at the tactics used by predator and prey.
programme.desc: We follow the worlds best pack hunters; from the iconic grey wolf to the surprising collaboration between humans and dolphins, these are predators at their most inventive and cunning.

programme.title: Natures Mass Attacks
programme.sub-title: We focus on the iconic migratory animals of Africa, North America and Oceania as they travel long distances through some of the worlds most stunning landscapes and battle extreme odds of survival.
programme.desc: We follow the worlds best pack hunters; from the iconic grey wolf to the surprising collaboration between humans and dolphins, these are predators at their most inventive and cunning.

programme.title: Deadly Hunters
programme.sub-title: Planet Earth is home to fearsome creatures equipped to maintain their position as apex predators - they are armed to the teeth and possess a predatory prowess few can escape.
programme.desc: We take a look at some of the animals that have led the way in refining their skills as masterful huntsmen; using their size, strength and unique weapons, animals use it all in order to survive.

programme.title: Hot Life: Africa
programme.sub-title: The lions prey tends to eat when the hunters rest; this means when the sun is at its hottest. A rise in temperature affects the behaviour of the animals that live in these scorching territories.
programme.desc: The threat of climate change is above all a risk for those who live in hot regions of the world like Africa; will its incredible living beings be able to resist a little longer?

programme.title: Hot Life: Africa
programme.sub-title: Leopards live in a thousand ecosystems from the rainy jungles of India to the driest regions of Africa; they adapt to almost any climate, feeding on over 100 different species.
programme.desc: The threat of climate change is above all a risk for those who live in hot regions of the world like Africa; will its incredible living beings be able to resist a little longer?

programme.title: Massive Africa
programme.sub-title: Zambias Luangwa Valleys vast, vibrant vistas pulsate with one of the worlds largest concentrations of wildlife; the Luangwa River powers its vitality through 15,000 km2 of grasslands and forests.
programme.desc: An action-packed adventure through Africas last untamed majestic wildernesses; gain new perspective on the continents wonderlands, iconic natural marvels, and awe-inspiring wildlife spectacles.

programme.title: Massive Africa
programme.sub-title: The sheer enormity and monumental scale of the Namib Desert leaves no doubt that this 55-million-year-old landscape reigns supreme as Africas most magnificent untamed wilderness.
programme.desc: An action-packed adventure through Africas last untamed majestic wildernesses; gain new perspective on the continents wonderlands, iconic natural marvels, and awe-inspiring wildlife spectacles.

programme.title: The Elephant Hospital
programme.sub-title: The team of vets are giving an elephant an endoscopy to check on the progress of her cancer treatment, and Paul helps an elephant arriving in AandE with chronic diarrhoea.
programme.desc: Take a trip to the worlds largest hospital devoted solely to treating elephants: the Elephant Hospital in Lampang in Thailand, which cares for over 100 sick, injured or neglected elephants each year.

programme.title: Outback Vet
programme.sub-title: A puppy fights against a deadly disease in the Karratha Vet Hospital, a chicken gets a prosthetic leg, and Dr Lu volunteers in a koala crisis caused by bushfires on Kangaroo Island.
programme.desc: Meet Rick Fenny, a 40-year career veterinarian; he regularly embarks on a round trip across Western Australia to visit remote clients, working with animals in some of the most hostile conditions.

programme.title: Wildest Survival
programme.sub-title: Meet the animals that live in the extremes who have created unique tools and techniques to cope with the harshest challenges to their continued survival.
programme.desc: We explore the extraordinary lives of natures wildest, most incredible, and sometimes weirdest animals and discover how they have learned to adapt, survive and evolve in every corner of the Earth.

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.sub-title: Jeremy embarks on an epic mission to reveal the real creature behind the worlds most famous river monster - the Loch Ness Monster. Will he uncover the legend of legends?
programme.desc: Extreme angler Jeremy Wade is on the hunt for freshwater fish with a taste for human flesh. Using forensic methods, Jeremy illustrates to the viewer how these river monsters are constructed to kill.

programme.sub-title: The gallery forests are the domain of a leopardess; for days she is almost invisible, but then strikes out of nowhere. For some she means sudden death, but then she has a cub to take care of.
programme.desc: The gallery forests of the Serengeti are the realm of a phantom; the shadowy thickets are the domain of a leopardess. We follow her journey as she raises her growing family.

programme.title: Patagonia: Earths Secret Paradise
programme.sub-title: We follow the path of the relentless wind from the Andes peaks sweeping east through Patagonias desert and discover a world of maras, penguins, and baby guanacos that are Patagonias very own camels.
programme.desc: This three-part series discovers the surprising stories of the unusual wildlife and the people that survive in epic Patagonian landscapes of volcanoes, glaciers, desert and treacherous oceans.

programme.sub-title: The gallery forests are the domain of a leopardess; for days she is almost invisible, but then strikes out of nowhere. For some she means sudden death, but then she has a cub to take care of.

programme.title: Backyard Bears of Transylvania
programme.desc: An ancient bear cult has survived deep in the Transylvanian forests - here Europes greatest land predator is a symbol of rebirth, but conflict is unavoidable with ever-increasing numbers.

programme.title: Germanys Wild North
programme.desc: Filmmaker Uwe Anders spent two years observing the wildlife of Germanys north, a region that defies all expectations with its incredible biodiversity and spectacular animal behaviour.

programme.title: Slovenia: Where Nature Goes
programme.desc: Slovenia boasts a stunning variety of natural monuments, scenic landscapes and wildlife; the country has also been given top spot in a United Nations list of the most sustainable national lifestyles.

programme.title: Polands Wild East
programme.desc: Eastern Poland is one of Europes last wild regions; the Biebrza lowlands make up the biggest national park in Poland and are of the utmost value for beavers, otters and countless aquatic birds.

programme.title: The Elephant Hospital
programme.sub-title: An elephant is brought into AandE with a suspected deadly herpes virus, Kat treats the infected foot of a female elephant, and we visit the largest herd in the hospital swimming in the river.
programme.desc: Take a trip to the worlds largest hospital devoted solely to treating elephants: the Elephant Hospital in Lampang in Thailand, which cares for over 100 sick, injured or neglected elephants each year.

programme.title: Outback Vet
programme.sub-title: Cyclone Damien, the biggest cyclone to hit Karratha for ten years, heads towards the Vet Hospital; meanwhile, a lady prepares to cross Australia by camel in the Pilbara desert.
programme.desc: Meet Rick Fenny, a 40-year career veterinarian; he regularly embarks on a round trip across Western Australia to visit remote clients, working with animals in some of the most hostile conditions.

programme.title: Wildest Survival
programme.sub-title: To reach adulthood, animals must constantly overcome many obstacles; from mantids to scimitar-horned oryx, some animals have adapted in surprising ways to ensure they make it to old age unscathed.
programme.desc: We explore the extraordinary lives of natures wildest, most incredible, and sometimes weirdest animals and discover how they have learned to adapt, survive and evolve in every corner of the Earth.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Its birthing season on Jackie Barlows alpaca farm, and Peter heads over to West Yorkshire to open a brand-new animal hospital run by his friends and colleagues.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Peter rushes into Skeldale on his day off to try to save a lamb of Richard Bells, and Julians treating a very poorly one-week old llama called Noah at Suzanne Bensons trekking centre.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Its Julzs last week; an encounter with lions scatters the Stork pack, Julz spots the Kakuli puppies feeding on a puku carcass, and the Manzi pack fight a warthog by the Luangwa River.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.
